analyzed: sannipatitaiḥ pañca sahasraiḥ sarvaiḥ gandharva śata sahasraiḥ pūrva buddha paryupāsitaiḥ tathāgata prātihārya dṛṣṭaiḥ sārdham sarvābhiḥ mahā yakṣiṇībhiḥ

translated: great female yakshas as the foremost.

translated: And with the world guardians Shatakratu, Brahma, Vaishravana, Dhritarashtra, Virudhaka, Virupaksha, Manibhadra, Putra, and Pūrṇabhadra, he was seated.

original: atha taiḥ sarvaistathāgataṃ siṃhāsananiṣaṇṇaṃ jñātvā svakasvakaiḥ kuśalamūlaistathāgataṃ divyālaṃkāravastrapuṣpamālyadhūpavilepanavādyaśabdena
analyzed: atha taiḥ sarvaiḥ tathāgatam siṃhāsana niṣaṇṇam jñātvā svaka svakaiḥ kuśala mūlaiḥ tathāgatam divya alaṃkāra vastra puṣpa mālya dhūpa vilepana vādya śabdena
translated: Then, knowing that the Tathāgata was seated on the lion throne, they each, with their own roots of goodness, honored the Tathāgata with divine ornaments, garments, flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, and the sounds of music,

analyzed: mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ śata sahasra koṭiśas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya arcitaḥ ca
translated: worshipped him, circumambulated him hundreds of thousands of millions of times, and made offerings to him.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bhagavān sarvasattvamahākaruṇājñānasthitaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpanno'bhūt /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bhagavān sarva sattva mahā karuṇā jñāna sthitam nāma samādhim
translated: At that time, the Blessed One entered the samādhi called Abiding in the Knowledge of Great Compassion for All Beings.

original: tena samādhidhāraṇabalena trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātavaḥ ābhayā avabhāsitā abhūvan /
analyzed: tena samādhi dhāraṇa balena tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātavaḥ ābhayā avabhāsitāḥ abhūvan
translated: By the power of retaining that samādhi, the great trichiliocosm was illuminated with light.

analyzed: sarva rūpāṇi sphuṭitāni
translated: All forms were revealed.

original: ye ca sattvā jātyandhāḥ cakṣuṣā rūpāṇi paśyanti sma /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ jāti andhāḥ cakṣuṣā rūpāṇi paśyanti sma
translated: Those beings who were born blind saw forms with their eyes.

original: vadhirāḥ śrotreṇa śabdān śṛṇvanti sma /🔽rogaspṛṣṭā vigatarogā bhavanti sma /
analyzed: vadhirāḥ śrotreṇa śabdān śṛṇvanti sma  roga spṛṣṭāḥ vigata rogāḥ bhavanti sma
translated: The deaf heard sounds with their ears.🔽Those afflicted with disease became free from disease.

original: nagnāśca vastrāvṛtā vabhūvuḥ /🔽unmattāḥ smṛtiṃ pratilabhante sma /
analyzed: nagnāḥ ca vastra āvṛtāḥ vabhūvuḥ  unmattāḥ smṛtim pratilabhante sma
translated: The naked became clothed.🔽The insane regained their memory.

analyzed: hīna kāyāḥ paripūrṇa indriyāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Those with incomplete faculties became complete.

analyzed: daridra dhanāni pratilabhante sma
translated: The poor obtained wealth.

original: sattvānāṃ yaḥ khalu dhanavastubhogavihīna āsīt sa dhanavastubhogasampanno'bhūt /
analyzed: sattvānām yaḥ khalu dhana vastu bhoga vihīnaḥ āsīt sa dhana vastu bhoga sampannaḥ bhūt
translated: Those beings who were deprived of wealth, goods, and enjoyments became endowed with wealth, goods, and enjoyments.

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ sarva sukha samarpitāḥ sarva āśā paripūrṇāḥ abhūvan
translated: All beings were filled with all kinds of happiness and had all their wishes fulfilled.

original: trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātau ye kecit sattvā anuśāsanadharmaśravaṇāya yena bhagavān tenāṃjaliṃ praṇamya upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātau ye kecid sattvāḥ anuśāsana dharma śravaṇāya yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamya upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: In the great trichiliocosm, all beings who were inclined to listen to the Dharma teaching, bowed with folded hands in the direction of the Blessed One and approached him.

original: ye sattvāḥ devabhūtāste sarvadevasukhaṃ saṃprahāya buddhānusmṛtiṃ kṛtvā dharmaśravaṇāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ deva bhūtāḥ te sarva deva sukham saṃprahāya buddha anusmṛtim kṛtvā dharma śravaṇāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Those beings who were born as gods, having abandoned all divine happiness, recollecting the Buddha, approached the Blessed One in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: ye sattvā manuṣyabhūtāste ca manuṣyasukhaṃ parityajya dharmaśravaṇakāmāya yena bhagavāṃstena upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ manuṣya bhūtāḥ te ca manuṣya sukham parityajya dharma śravaṇa kāmāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Those beings who were born as humans, having abandoned human happiness, desirous of listening to the Dharma, approached the Blessed One.

original: ye sattvā nāgayakṣarākṣasapretapiśācabhūtāste buddhānusmṛtiṃ prāpya sarvasattveṣu maitracittā bhūtvā kāyacittasukhaṃ labdhvā dharmaśravaṇāya
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ nāga yakṣa rākṣasa preta piśāca bhūtāḥ te buddha anusmṛtim prāpya sarva sattveṣu maitra cittāḥ bhūtvā kāya citta sukham labdhvā dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Those beings who were born as nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, pretas, or piśācas, having attained recollection of the Buddha, having become full of loving-kindness towards all beings, having attained bodily and mental happiness,

analyzed: yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: approached the Blessed One in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: ye sattvā yamaloke andhatamisrāyāṃ jātāste'pi buddhānubhāvena ekakṣaṇaṃ smṛtiṃ labdhvā parasparaṃ saṃjānate sma /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ yama loke andhatamisrāyām jātāḥ te api buddha anubhāvena eka kṣaṇam smṛtim labdhvā parasparam saṃjānate sma
translated: Those beings who were born in the world of Yama in the darkness of great darkness, by the power of the Buddha, in one moment obtained mindfulness and recognized each other.

analyzed: te mahā tamisrābhyaḥ parimuktāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: They were liberated from the great darkness.

analyzed: sarve satvāḥ parasparam maitra cittāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: All beings became friendly towards each other.

analyzed: teṣām upakleśāḥ kṣīṇāḥ abhūvan
translated: Their afflictions were extinguished.

original: tena khalu samayena mahāpṛthivī ṣaḍ vikāraṃ prakampate unnamati avanamati sma /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena mahā pṛthivī ṣaṣ vikāram prakampate unnamati avanamati sma
translated: At that time, the great earth shook in six ways, rising up and sinking down.

original: atha tasyāṃ parṣadi maṃjuśrīkumārabhūtaḥ sanniṣaṇṇaḥ san bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāryāvalokiteśvarametadavocat /
analyzed: atha tasyām parṣadi maṃjuśrī kumāra bhūtaḥ san niṣaṇṇaḥ san bodhisattvam mahāsattvam ārya avalokiteśvaram etat avocat
translated: Then in that assembly, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, who was seated, said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Noble Avalokiteśvara:

original: kulaputra mahābodhisattvaparṣadi avabhāsitāyāṃ mahāparṣadaḥ pūrvanimittaṃ parisphuṭam /
analyzed: kula putra mahā bodhisattva parṣadi avabhāsitāyām mahā parṣadaḥ pūrva nimittam parisphuṭam
translated: Son of good family, in this great assembly of bodhisattvas, which has been illuminated, the clear sign of the prior auspicious sign of the great assembly has appeared.

analyzed: aneka bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇām ca vyākaraṇam prakaṭitam
translated: And the prediction of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas has been revealed.

analyzed: dharma mahāvākyasya pūrva nimittam saṃdṛśyate
translated: The prior auspicious sign of the great Dharma discourse is seen.

original: kulaputra anekānāṃ ca bodhisattvakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ sarvāśāparipūri mahājñānapratilambho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kula putra anekānām ca bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇām sarva āśā paripūri mahā jñāna pratilambhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Noble one, it will fulfill all the wishes of many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of bodhisattvas and bring about the attainment of great wisdom.

original: tat kulaputra sattvānāṃ kāruṇyamutpādya hitāya sukhāya yāvadanuttarasyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpanāya tathāgataṃ paripṛccha /
analyzed: tat kula putra sattvānām kāruṇyam utpādya hitāya sukhāya yāvat anuttarasyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpanāya tathāgatam paripṛccha
translated: Therefore, noble one, generate compassion for beings and ask the Tathagata for the sake of their benefit, happiness, and establishment in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: santi kulaputra sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye bhaviṣyanti pāpakāriṇo daridrāḥ kṛśā durvarṇaśarīrā jarāvyādhiparipīḍitāḥ parīttabhogā
analyzed: santi kula putra sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye bhaviṣyanti pāpa kāriṇaḥ daridrāḥ kṛśāḥ durvarṇa śarīrāḥ jarā vyādhi paripīḍitāḥ parītta bhogāḥ
translated: Noble one, there will be beings in the future time who will be sinful, poor, weak, with bodies of poor complexion, afflicted by old age and disease, with little wealth,

analyzed: a paribhāvita kāyāḥ alpa āyuṣkāḥ alpa buddhayaḥ rāga dveṣa moha paripīḍitāḥ
translated: with bodies not well developed, with little life, little wisdom, afflicted by desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: teṣāmarthāya kulaputra tathāgatamadhyeṣaya dharmadeśanāyai tat te kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyati dīrgharātraṃ sattvānāmarthāya hitāya sukhāya sarvāvyādhipraśamanāya
analyzed: teṣām arthāya kula putra tathāgatam adhyeṣaya dharma deśanāyai tat te kṛtam bhaviṣyati dīrgharātram sattvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya sarva a vyādhi praśamanāya
translated: For their sake, noble one, request the Tathagata to teach the Dharma. That will be done by you for the sake, benefit, and happiness of beings for a long time, for the complete pacification of all illnesses,

analyzed: sarva pāpa nivāraṇāya sarva pāpa praśamanāya sarva śā paripūraṇa artham yāvat anuttara parinirvāṇa artham
translated: for the prevention of all evil, for the complete pacification of all evil, for the fulfillment of all wishes, up to the unsurpassed complete nirvana.🔽Noble one, you should request the Tathagata to teach the Dharma.

original: atha āryāvalokiśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo daśadiśamavalokya gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāstathāgatakoṭīrmamanasi kurvan yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ praṇamya
analyzed: atha ārya avalokiśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ daśa diśam avalokya gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ tathāgata koṭīḥ kurvan yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamya
translated: Then the noble Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, having looked in the ten directions, having brought to mind the many millions of Tathagatas equal to the sands of the Ganges River, having bowed with joined palms to the Blessed One,

analyzed: tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya paṃca maṇḍalena praṇipatya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: having circumambulated him three times, having prostrated with the five limbs, spoke to the Blessed One thus:

original: santi bhagavan sattvāḥ paścime kāle bhaviṣyanti jarāvyādhiśokamṛtyuduḥkhakālamṛtyuparipīḍitāḥ kṛśā durvarṇā alpāyuṣkāḥ parīttabhogā aparibhāvitakāyāste
analyzed: santi bhagavan sattvāḥ paścime kāle bhaviṣyanti jarā vyādhi śoka mṛtyu duḥkha kāla mṛtyu paripīḍitāḥ kṛśāḥ durvarṇāḥ alpa āyuṣkāḥ parītta bhogāḥ a paribhāvita kāyāḥ te
translated: Blessed One, there will be beings in the future time who will be afflicted by the suffering of old age, disease, sorrow, death, and untimely death, who will be emaciated, pale, short-lived, with little wealth, and whose bodies will not be well-developed.

original: parasparāṇi mātsaryadauḥśīlyacittatayā ghātayiṣyanti parasparāṇi dhanabhogaiśvaryāṇyāpahariṣyanti hāsyalāsyanāṭyakrīḍābhiratāḥ anitye nityasaṃjñinaḥ
analyzed: parasparāṇi mātsarya dauḥśīlya cittatayā ghātayiṣyanti parasparāṇi dhana bhoga aiśvaryāṇi āpahariṣyanti hāsya lāsya nāṭya krīḍā abhiratāḥ anitye nitya saṃjñinaḥ  /
translated: They, due to the mind of stinginess and immorality towards each other, will kill each other, and will take away each other's wealth, possessions, and power. They will be devoted to laughter, play, dance, and amusement, perceiving the impermanent as permanent,

analyzed: aśubhe śubha saṃjñinaḥ
translated: perceiving the inauspicious as auspicious.

analyzed: te tad hetau tad nidānā sattvāḥ nānā prakāraiḥ vihaga naraka tiryagyoni yama lokeṣu ca upapatsyante
translated: Due to that cause and that condition, those beings will be reborn in various ways in the hells, as animals, in the realm of Yama, and in the world of ghosts.

original: tat teṣāmahaṃ bhagavan arthāya hitāya sarvāśāparipūrarṇārthaṃ yāvat tathāgatajñānāharaṇārthaṃ buddhakṣetropapattaye sarvapāpanivāraṇārthaṃ
analyzed: tat teṣām aham bhagavan arthāya hitāya sarva āśā paripūrarṇa artham yāvat tathāgata jñāna āharaṇa artham buddhakṣetra upapattaye sarva pāpa nivāraṇa artham
translated: For their sake, Blessed One, for their benefit, for the fulfillment of all wishes, up to the attainment of the wisdom of the Tathagatas, for the sake of rebirth in the Buddha-field, for the prevention of all evil,

original: bhāṣasva bhagavan bhāṣasva sugato nāsti tathāgatasya tajjñānaṃ yadaviditam adṛṣṭam aśrutam avijñātameva /
analyzed: bhāṣasva bhagavan bhāṣasva sugataḥ na asti tathāgatasya tat jñānam yat aviditam adṛṣṭam aśrutam avijñātam eva
translated: Speak, Blessed One, speak, Sugata, there is no knowledge of the Tathagata that is unknown, unseen, unheard, or unrecognized.

original: bahavo bhagavan bodhisattvabhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā devanāgā yakṣagandharvāsurakinnarāśca samāgatā dharmasāṃkathyaṃ śrotukāmāḥ pūrvabuddhaparyupāsitāḥ
analyzed: bahavaḥ bhagavan bodhisattva bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ deva nāgāḥ yakṣa gandharva asura kinnarāḥ ca samāgatāḥ dharma sāṃkathyam śrotu kāmāḥ pūrva buddha paryupāsitāḥ  /
translated: Many bodhisattvas, monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, and kinnaras have assembled, desiring to hear the Dharma discourse, having attended to the Buddhas of the past,

analyzed: saprajñā jātāḥ te nirāśībhūtā prakramiṣyanti
translated: They have become wise, but if they become hopeless, they will depart.

original: atha te sarve yathā samāgatāḥ parṣat paṃcamaṇḍalena praṇipatya ekakaṇṭhena evamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te sarve yathā samāgatāḥ parṣad paṃca maṇḍalena praṇipatya eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: Then all those assembled in the assembly, having prostrated with the five-point prostration, said with one voice:

original: sādhu bhagavan bhāṣasva bhagavan bhāṣasva sugataḥ /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan bhāṣasva bhagavan bhāṣasva sugataḥ
translated: Excellent, Blessed One, speak, Blessed One, speak, Sugata.

original: atha bhagavān dvirapi trirapi adhyeṣaṇāṃ viditvā daśadiśamavalokya valgumaṇojñasvareṇāryāvalokiteśvaraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat
analyzed: atha bhagavān dvis api tris api adhyeṣaṇām viditvā daśa diśam avalokya valgu maṇojña svareṇa āryāvalokiteśvaram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the request made twice and thrice, looked in the ten directions and with a sweet and pleasant voice said this to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Āryāvalokiteśvara:

original: yadi tvamānanda yanmayā dharmo bhāṣitaḥ śruto dhārayituṃ tat sarvaṃ na dhāraye na vācaye na pūjaye na vaistārikīkuryā tvayā mama nāparādhye
analyzed: yadi tvam ānanda yat mayā dharmaḥ bhāṣitaḥ śrutaḥ dhārayitum tat sarvam na dhāraye na vācaye na pūjaye na vaistārikīkuryāḥ tvayā mama na aparādhye  /
translated: If you, Ānanda, were not to uphold, recite, worship, and make it widely known, all the Dharma that I have spoken and you have heard, you would not be offending me,

original: na cāśuśrūṣā kṛtā bhave na cāśrāvakatvam /
analyzed: na ca a śuśrūṣā kṛtā bhave na ca a śrāvaka tvam
translated: and you would not be acting without heedfulness or not as a disciple.

original: yaśca imaṃ dharmaparyāya na dhāraye na vācaye na pūjaye na saṃprakāśaye na manasikuryā sa mām aparādhye aśuśrūṣā kṛtā bhave aśrāvakatvaṃ bhave
analyzed: yaḥ ca imam dharmaparyāya na dhāraye na vācaye na pūjaye na saṃprakāśaye na manasi kuryāḥ sa mām aparādhye a śuśrūṣā kṛtā bhave a śrāvaka tvam bhave
translated: But if someone were not to uphold, recite, worship, teach, or pay attention to this Dharma discourse, they would be offending me, acting without heedfulness, and not being a disciple.

original: tasmāttarhi tvamānanda satkṛtya ayaṃ dharmaparyāyo dhārayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi tvam ānanda satkṛtya ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, you should uphold this Dharma discourse with respect.

original: ayaṃ te tathāgatasyānuttarasamyaksaṃbodhatathāgatakṛtyaṃ kariṣyati paścime kāle paścime samaye sarvasattvānām /
analyzed: ayam te tathāgatasya anuttara samyaksaṃbodha tathāgata kṛtyam kariṣyati paścime kāle paścime samaye sarva sattvānām
translated: This will accomplish the Tathāgata's work for the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the Tathāgata in the future time, for all beings.

original: asmin khalu punardharmaparyāye bhagavatā bhāṣyamāṇe ṣaṣṭīnāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāmanupādāyāsravebhyaścittāni vimuktāni saptānāṃ śatānāṃ bodhisattvasamādhipratilaṃbho'bhūt
analyzed: asmin khalu punar dharmaparyāye bhagavatā bhāṣyamāṇe ṣaṣṭīnām prāṇi sahasrāṇām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni saptānām śatānām bodhisattva samādhi pratilaṃbhaḥ bhūt
translated: Moreover, when this Dharma discourse was being spoken by the Blessed One, the minds of sixty thousand beings were liberated from the defilements without further appropriation. Seven hundred bodhisattvas attained the samādhi.

analyzed: pañcānām śatānām nānā buddhakṣetra vyākaraṇa pratilaṃbhaḥ bhūt
translated: Five hundred attained the prediction of the various buddha-fields.

analyzed: navatīnām prāṇi sahasrāṇām sarva kleśa vinirmuktāḥ sarva akṣaṇa apāya durgatayaḥ prahīṇāḥ
translated: The afflictions of nine hundred thousand beings were completely eliminated, and all the unfortunate destinies and lower realms were abandoned.

original: athāryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ punarbhagavantametadavocat /🔽ayaṃ bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ paścimakāle paścimasamaye teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ śrotṝṇāṃ dhārayitṝṇāṃ mānayitṝṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca lekhakānāṃ tathāgatakṛtyaṃ
analyzed: atha āryāvalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ punar bhagavantam etat avocat  ayam bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ paścima kāle paścima samaye teṣām kula putrāṇām śrotṝṇām dhārayitṝṇām mānayitṝṇām teṣām ca lekhakānām tathāgata kṛtyam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Noble Avalokiteśvara said this to the Blessed One:🔽Blessed One, this Dharma discourse will accomplish the work of the Tathāgata

analyzed: kariṣyati
translated: for those sons of good family who listen to it, uphold it, honor it, and write it down in the future time, in the future period.

analyzed: vyākṛtāḥ te yathā īpsiteṣu nānā buddhakṣetreṣu
translated: They are predicted in the various desired buddha-fields.

original: ye ca sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye hāsyanāṭyagītavāditeṣu nānāvyākṣepabahulā rāgadveṣamohāndhā ratikrīḍāsaṃjñinaḥ anitye nityasaṃjñinaḥ
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye hāsya nāṭya gīta vāditeṣu nānā vyākṣepa bahulāḥ rāga dveṣa moha andhāḥ rati krīḍā saṃjñinaḥ anitye nitya saṃjñinaḥ  /
translated: Those beings who in the later times, in the later times, are full of various distractions in laughter, drama, singing, and music, blind with passion, hatred, and delusion, regarding pleasure and play as real, regarding the impermanent as permanent,

original: īrṣyāmātsaryadauḥśīlyaparigṛhītā na pūjayiṣyanti na mānayiṣyanti na śraddhāsyanti na pattīyiṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti na śroṣyanti na pratipattyā
analyzed: īrṣyā mātsarya dauḥśīlya parigṛhītāḥ na pūjayiṣyanti na mānayiṣyanti na śraddhāsyanti na pattīyiṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti na śroṣyanti na pratipattyā
translated: and are full of envy, stinginess, and immorality, will not worship, will not honor, will not have faith, will not believe, will not uphold, will not listen, and will not practice

analyzed: pratipatsyante
translated: with practice.

original: te taṃ pūrvakarmaśubhaphalaṃ parikṣepaṃ kṛtvā nānāduḥkhadaurmanasyaṃ nārakaṃ duḥkhamanubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te tam pūrva karma śubha phalam parikṣepam kṛtvā nānā duḥkha daurmanasyam nārakam duḥkham anubhaviṣyanti
translated: Having exhausted that previous good karma and its results, they will experience various sufferings and mental disturbances, the suffering of hell.

analyzed: tatas te anekāni kalpa koṭī śatāni duḥkham anubhavitvā naraka tiryagyoni yama lokeṣu vā upapatsyante
translated: Then, having experienced suffering for many hundreds of millions of eons, they will be reborn in the realms of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: dīrgharātramakalyāṇamitravaśāḥ paścānutāpino bhaviṣyanti imaṃ kṣaṇaṃ virāgayitvā /
analyzed: dīrgharātram akalyāṇa mitra vaśāḥ paścā anutāpinaḥ bhaviṣyanti imam kṣaṇam virāgayitvā
translated: For a long time, under the influence of bad friends, they will regret having abandoned this moment.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kāya vāc manaḥ saṃvareṇa bhavitavyam
translated: Therefore, one should be restrained in body, speech, and mind.

original: buddhadharmasaṃghe abhedyaprasādena sarvasattveṣu maitracittena īrṣyāmātsaryadauḥśīlyacittaparivarjitena krodhaparivarjitena bhavitavyam
analyzed: buddha dharma saṃghe abhedya prasādena sarva sattveṣu maitra cittena īrṣyā mātsarya dauḥśīlya citta parivarjitena krodha parivarjitena bhavitavyam
translated: One should have unshakable faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, a mind of loving-kindness towards all beings, be free from jealousy, stinginess, and unwholesome thoughts, and free from anger.

original: atha sā yathāsamāgatā parṣa taistaiḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraiḥ tathāgataṃ pūjayati sma /
analyzed: atha sā yathā samāgatā taiḥ taiḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraiḥ tathāgatam pūjayati sma
translated: Then the assembly that had gathered, with those various meritorious actions, worshipped the Tathāgata.

analyzed: divya puṣpa gandha mālya vilepana vastra ābharaṇaiḥ kili kili prakṣveḍita śabdaiḥ ca divya tūrya tāḍāva cara saṃgīteḥ sādhukāram pradadau
translated: With divine flowers, incense, garlands, ointments, garments, and ornaments, with sounds of kilikili and prakṣveḍita, and with the music of divine musical instruments and songs, they expressed their approval.

original: tad yathā sādhu sādhu bhagavan subhāṣitamidaṃ mahādharmaparyāyaṃ sarvasattvānāmarthāya tathāgataśāsanacirasthityartham /
analyzed: tat yathā sādhu sādhu bhagavan su bhāṣitam idam mahā dharmaparyāyam sarva sattvānām arthāya tathāgata śāsana cira sthiti artham
translated: Excellent, excellent, Blessed One! Well spoken is this great Dharma discourse for the benefit of all beings, for the sake of the long duration of the Tathāgata's teachings.

analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: kiṃnāmāyaṃ bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ kathaṃ ca vayaṃ bhagavan dhārayāmaḥ /
analyzed: kiṃnāmā ayam bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ katham ca vayam bhagavan dhārayāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, what is the name of this Dharma discourse? And how should we remember it, Blessed One?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tasmāttarhi tvamānanda imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sarvatathāgatajñānabodhisattvabhūmikramaṇamityapi nāma dhāraya /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi tvam ānanda imam dharmaparyāyam sarva tathāgata jñāna bodhisattva bhūmi kramaṇam iti api nāma dhāraya
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, remember this Dharma discourse as 'The Ascertainment of the Stages of the Bodhisattva Ground of the Knowledge of All Tathāgatas.'

analyzed: ṛddhi vikurvāṇa mahātma sannipātam iti api nāma dhāraya
translated: Also hold the name Gathering of the Great Ones with Miraculous Transformations.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna sattva avalokana buddhakṣetra sandarśana vyūham iti api nāma dhāraya
translated: Also hold the name Array of Contemplating Sentient Beings and Displaying Buddha-fields by the Empowerment of All Tathagatas.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamānāḥ āryāvalokiteśvaramaṃjuśrīvajrapāṇiprabhṛtayaḥ sarve bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sarve ca mahāśrāvakāḥ sarve ca śakrabrahmalokapālāścatvāraśca
analyzed: ātta mānāḥ ārya avalokiteśvara maṃjuśrī vajrapāṇi prabhṛtayaḥ sarve bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sarve ca mahāśrāvakāḥ sarve ca śakra brahma lokapālāḥ catvāraḥ ca
translated: The noble Avalokiteshvara, Manjushri, Vajrapani, and so forth, all the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, all the great hearers, all the Shakra, Brahma, and Lokapalas, the four

analyzed: mahā rājāḥ mahā yakṣiṇyaḥ anaupamyāḥ vimalaprabhā prabhāvatī bhīmā śrī śaṃkhinī haritā mahādevī prabhṛtayaḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ
translated: great kings, the great yakshinis, Anupama, Vimalaprabha, Pravahana, Bhimasri, Shankhini, Harita, the great goddess, and so forth, the devas, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: sā ca sarvāvatī parṣayathāsamāgatā bhagavato bhāṣitamabhinandya sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: sā ca sarvāvatī bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhinandya sādhukāram adāt
translated: and the entire assembly that had gathered there rejoiced in the Blessed One's teaching and exclaimed Excellent!

analyzed: sādhu sādhu bhagavan
translated: Excellent, Blessed One!

analyzed: iti sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhāna sattva valokana buddhakṣetra sandarśana vyūham nāma mahāyāna sūtram
translated: Thus concludes the Mahayana sutra called The Array of Contemplating Sentient Beings and Displaying Buddha-fields by the Empowerment of All Tathagatas.
